header.name: chaos/preprocessor/detection/compare.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro that compares identifiers.

macro.abstract: The macro detects whether two registered identifiers are the same.
macro.para: If a and b are both the same identifier and that identifier is registered, this macro expands to 1. Otherwise, it expands to 0.

The lowercase and uppercase letters, the underscore, and all of the C and C++ keywords are pre-registered by the library. Further identifiers can be registered with a macro definition as follows (where xyz is a placeholder for some identifier):
#define CHAOS_PP_COMPARE_xyz(x) x
Registration of the identifier ID is prohibited, because that would form , which is a library primitive.
macro.listing:
#include
#define A int
(A, int) // 1 (A, double) // 0
#define CHAOS_PP_COMPARE_boost(x) x
#define B boost
(B, abc) // 0 (B, boost) // 1

macro.abstract: The macro detects whether two registered identifiers are the same.
macro.para: This macro behaves identically to except that it does not provide the delay necessary to allow its arguments to expand on input.
macro.listing:
#include
#define Object Result
#define CHAOS_PP_COMPARE_Object(x) x
(Object, Object) // 0 (Object, Object) // 1
